thread.title: CANVAS Kicks Off Outdoor Musuem Show With Party -- WEST PAL
thread.title_full: CANVAS Kicks Off Outdoor Musuem Show With Party -- WEST PAL

author: West Palm Beach Downtown Development Authority
title: CANVAS Kicks Off Outdoor Musuem Show With Party -- WEST PAL
text:
WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. , Oct. 15, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- A crowd of more than 350 art enthusiasts attended the kick-off party for CANVAS , the outdoor museum show coming to Downtown West Palm Beach on November 8 -22. Guests enjoyed drinks courtesy of Tito's Handmade Vodka and Perrier® Sparkling Natural Mineral Water, a cocktail creation experience with Bombay Sapphire, hors d'oeuvres from NYY Steak, a silent auction and a preview from some of the renowned artists participating in the inaugural art event. The party took place October 10 at the Graffiti Garden at 501 Fern Street, proceeds will benefit CANVAS Art Charities , a non-profit organization dedicated to funding visual arts to enrich public spaces and foster social and economic outcomes. Jonathan Duerr was the evening's emcee and kept the energy upbeat throughout the night. Guests mixed and mingled with CANVAS artists including Cheryl Maeder , Jose Bedia , Sean Yoro and Zeus. Other notable guests included Elin Nordegren, Jeff Koons , Brian and Sarah Vickers , Wyatt Koch , Greg Norman Jr. , Gil de Ferran and Matthieu Rosinsky .
In addition to work by CANVAS artists, guests were visually wowed by roaming lampshade models provided by the Seminole Casino Coconut Creek and a Lamborghini Huracán from Palm Beach Lamborghini parked in front of the venue. 
"The kick-off event set the stage for what is to be a spectacular exhibition in November," said Nicole Henry , CANVAS founder and West Palm Beach gallerist. "Our guests had the opportunity to preview some of the finest work by artists participating in CANVAS while supporting a cause that funds art in public places."
For more information or to purchase tickets to the events, please visit www.canvaswpb.org . 
About CANVAS
CANVAS, November 8-22, 2015 , will offer interactive art experiences as a prelude to Art Basel . The two-week event will showcase over 20 artists from around the world, each of which will paint murals on buildings or construct sculptures throughout the Downtown District of West Palm Beach, Fla. CANVAS is the creative vision of gallerist Nicole Henry , and supported by the West Palm Beach Downtown Development Authority, Discover the Palm Beaches, Nicole Henry Fine Art , Palm Harbor Marina, NYY Steak, Seminole Casino Coconut Creek, Tito's Handmade Vodka, Perrier® Sparkling Natural Mineral Water, Field of Greens, McDonald Hopkins Law Firm, Merrill Lynch, Atlas Real Estate Partners, and Uber.
